alert.note: Alert for Southeast Suffolk; Southwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued March 13 at 4:05AM EDT until March 14 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 7 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to 1 1/2 feet of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. For the Coastal Flood Statement, up to 1/2 foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Southwest Suffolk and Southeast Suffolk Counties. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from midnight tonight to 7 AM EDT Tuesday. For the Coastal Flood Statement, until 5 AM EDT early this morning. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Expect up to 1 1/2 feet of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas, particularly for the late tonight through early tomorrow AM high tide. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...4 to 7 ft breaking waves will result in beach erosion and flooding along the oceanfront during the times of high tide with only minor erosion to dune structures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy rain during the times of high tide will likely exacerbate street flooding in coastal communities. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. GREAT SOUTH BAY AT LINDENHURST NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 3.1 FT, MODERATE 3.6 FT, MAJOR 4.1 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.5 FT, MODERATE 2.0 FT, MAJOR 2.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 13/02 AM 3.1/ 3.6 1.5/ 2.0 1.8/ 2.2 1 MINOR 13/03 PM 2.5/ 3.0 0.9/ 1.4 1.4/ 1.9 1 NONE 14/03 AM 3.2/ 3.7 1.7/ 2.2 2.0/ 2.5 1 MINOR 14/03 PM 2.5/ 3.0 0.9/ 1.4 1.5/ 2.0 1 NONE 15/04 AM 2.2/ 2.7 0.7/ 1.1 1.0/ 1.5 1-2 NONE 15/05 PM 2.1/ 2.6 0.5/ 1.0 1.1/ 1.6 2 NONE GREAT SOUTH BAY AT WEST SAYVILLE NY MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
